00010 #include "Jamoma.h"
00011 //#define USE_COREAUDIO

00013 static t_class  *class_jamoma_clock = NULL;
00014 static long             dsp_called = false;

00020 void jamoma_clock_initclass()
00021 {
00022         t_class *c = class_new("jamoma.clock", 
00023                                                         (method)jamoma_clock_new, 
00024                                                         (method)jamoma_clock_free, 
00025                                                         sizeof(t_jamoma_clock), 
00026                                                         (method)NULL, 
00027                                                         A_GIMME, 0);
00028 #ifndef USE_COREAUDIO
00029         class_addmethod(c, (method)jamoma_clock_dsp,    "dsp",          A_CANT, 0L);
00030         class_dspinit(c);
00031 #endif
00032         class_register(CLASS_NOBOX, c); 
00033         class_jamoma_clock = c;
00034 }
00035 
00036 
00037 t_object* jamoma_clock_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00038 {
00039         t_jamoma_clock *x = (t_jamoma_clock*)object_alloc(class_jamoma_clock);
00040         if(x){
00041                 x->sr = DEFAULT_SAMPLE_RATE;
00042                 x->one_over_sr = 1.0 / DEFAULT_SAMPLE_RATE;
00043                 x->samples_per_block = 64;
00044                 
00045                 dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, 1);
00046                 x->obj.z_misc = Z_PUT_LAST;                     // ... because our perform routine advances time to the next frame
00047                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);
00048                 
00049 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00050 #ifdef USE_COREAUDIO
00051                 jamoma_clock_setup_coreaudio(x);
00052                 start(x);
00053 #endif
00054 #endif
00055         }
00056         return (t_object*)x;
00057 }
00058 
00059 
00060 void jamoma_clock_free(t_jamoma_clock *x)
00061 {
00062         dsp_free((t_pxobject *)x);
00063 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00064         stop(x);
00065 #endif // MAC_VERSION
00066 }

00069 /************************************************************************************/
00070 #pragma mark -
00071 #pragma mark Methods -- MSP Master
00072 
00073 t_int* jamoma_clock_perform(t_int *w)
00074 {
00075         t_jamoma_clock *x = (t_jamoma_clock *)(w[1]);
00076                 
00077         // Move the clocks ahead for the next cycle
00078         x->current_samples += x->samples_per_block;
00079         x->current_time = ((x->current_samples * x->one_over_sr) * DEFAULT_TICKS_PER_SECOND);
00080 
00081         // TODO: do this for each scheduler -- but for now we just service the global scheduler
00082         jamoma_scheduler_update((t_jamoma_scheduler*)obj_jamoma_scheduler, &x->current_time);
00083 
00084         // TODO: is there another way to this:
00085         // reset the hack that we use in the dsp method to make sure this method isn't called multiple times
00086         dsp_called = false;
00087 
00088         return(w+2);
00089 }
00090 
00091 
00092 void jamoma_clock_dsp(t_jamoma_clock *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00093 {
00094         if(!dsp_called){
00095                 if(object_classname(x) != gensym("jamoma.clock"))
00096                         x = (t_jamoma_clock*)obj_jamoma_clock;
00097 
00098                 if(sp){
00099                         x->sr = (double)sp[0]->s_sr;
00100                         x->one_over_sr = 1.0 / (double)sp[0]->s_sr;
00101                         x->samples_per_block = sp[0]->s_n;
00102                 }
00103                 
00104                 dsp_add(jamoma_clock_perform, 1, x);
00105                 dsp_called = true;
00106         }
00107 }

00110 /************************************************************************************/
00111 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00112 #pragma mark -
00113 #pragma mark Methods -- CoreAudio Master
00114 
00115 // this is the audio processing callback
00116 OSStatus jamoma_clock_coreaudio_callback (AudioDeviceID                 inDevice, 
00117                                                                                 const AudioTimeStamp*   inNow, 
00118                                                                                 const AudioBufferList*  inInputData, 
00119                                                                                 const AudioTimeStamp*   inInputTime, 
00120                                                                                 AudioBufferList*                outOutputData, 
00121                                                                                 const AudioTimeStamp*   inOutputTime, 
00122                                                                                 void*                                   baton)
00123 {    
00124     t_jamoma_clock *x = (t_jamoma_clock*)baton;
00125     
00126     // load instance vars into registers    
00127     int numSamples = (x->deviceBufferSize / x->deviceFormat.mBytesPerFrame) * x->deviceFormat.mChannelsPerFrame;
00128                 // currently using the default of 512 samples per frame
00129                 
00130         // Move the clocks ahead for the next cycle
00131 //      x->current_samples += x->samples_per_block;
00132         x->current_samples += numSamples;
00133         x->current_time = ((x->current_samples * x->one_over_sr) * DEFAULT_TICKS_PER_SECOND);
00134 
00135         // TODO: do this for each scheduler -- but for now we just service the global scheduler
00136         jamoma_scheduler_update((t_jamoma_scheduler*)obj_jamoma_scheduler, &x->current_time);
00137 
00138      return kAudioHardwareNoError;     
00139 }

00142 void jamoma_clock_setup_coreaudio(t_jamoma_clock *x)
00143 {
00144     OSStatus    err = kAudioHardwareNoError;
00145     UInt32              count;    
00146         UInt32          vs;
00147 //      AudioStreamBasicDescription     stream;
00148 
00149         x->device = kAudioDeviceUnknown;
00150 
00151     x->initialized = NO;
00152 
00153     // get the default output device for the HAL
00154     count = sizeof(x->device);          // it is required to pass the size of the data to be returned
00155     err = AudioHardwareGetProperty(kAudioHardwarePropertyDefaultOutputDevice, &count, (void*)&x->device);
00156     if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError){
00157         fprintf(stderr, "get kAudioHardwarePropertyDefaultOutputDevice error %ld\n", err);
00158         return;
00159     }
00160 
00161     // get the buffersize that the default device uses for IO
00162     count = sizeof(x->deviceBufferSize);        // it is required to pass the size of the data to be returned
00163     err = AudioDeviceGetProperty(x->device, 0, false, kAudioDevicePropertyBufferSize, &count, &x->deviceBufferSize);
00164     if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError){
00165         fprintf(stderr, "get kAudioDevicePropertyBufferSize error %ld\n", err);
00166         return;
00167     }
00168     fprintf(stderr, "deviceBufferSize = %ld\n", x->deviceBufferSize);
00169    
00170     // get a description of the data format used by the default device
00171     count = sizeof(x->deviceFormat);    // it is required to pass the size of the data to be returned
00172     err = AudioDeviceGetProperty(x->device, 0, false, kAudioDevicePropertyStreamFormat, &count, &x->deviceFormat);
00173     if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError){
00174         fprintf(stderr, "get kAudioDevicePropertyStreamFormat error %ld\n", err);
00175         return;
00176     }
00177     if(x->deviceFormat.mFormatID != kAudioFormatLinearPCM){
00178         fprintf(stderr, "mFormatID !=  kAudioFormatLinearPCM\n");
00179         return;
00180     }
00181     if(!(x->deviceFormat.mFormatFlags & kLinearPCMFormatFlagIsFloat)){
00182         fprintf(stderr, "Sorry, currently only works with float format....\n");
00183         return;
00184     }
00185         
00186 // TODO: Test this!
00187         // set vector size for callbacks
00188         vs = x->samples_per_block = 64;
00189         count = sizeof(UInt32);
00190                 err = AudioDeviceGetProperty(x->device, 0, false, kAudioDevicePropertyBufferFrameSize, &count, &vs);
00191 /*
00192         count = sizeof(AudioStreamBasicDescription);
00193         err = AudioDeviceGetProperty(x->device, 0, true, kAudioDevicePropertyStreamFormat, &count, &stream);
00194         if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError){
00195                 fprintf(stderr, "bummer\n");
00196                 return;
00197         }
00198 */
00199         //stream.mSampleRate = sr;
00200         //status =  AudioDeviceSetProperty(x->ca_inputDevice->dev_id, NULL, 0, true, kAudioDevicePropertyStreamFormat, size, &stream);
00201         vs = x->samples_per_block = 64;
00202 
00203         err = AudioDeviceSetProperty(x->device, NULL, 0, true, kAudioDevicePropertyBufferFrameSize, count, &vs);
00204         if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError){               // the device might not support our current size...
00205                 AudioValueRange bufRange;
00206 
00207                 count = sizeof(AudioValueRange);
00208                 err = AudioDeviceGetProperty(x->device, 0, false, kAudioDevicePropertyBufferFrameSizeRange, &count, &bufRange);
00209                 if(bufRange.mMinimum > vs)
00210                         vs = bufRange.mMinimum;
00211                 else
00212                         vs = bufRange.mMaximum;
00213                 
00214                 //kAudioDevice
00215                 
00216                 err = AudioDeviceSetProperty(x->device, NULL, 0, true, kAudioDevicePropertyBufferFrameSize, sizeof(UInt32), &vs);
00217                 if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError){
00218                         fprintf(stderr, "big bummer d00d");
00219                         return;
00220                 }
00221         }
00222 
00223 // TODO: We really want an input instead of an output -- among others, it won't try to mix or clip any samples (which we aren't using anyway)
00224                 
00225 //      err = AudioDeviceSetProperty(x->device, NULL, 0, false, kAudioDevicePropertyBufferFrameSize, sizeof(UInt32), &vs);
00226 //      if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError){
00227 //              fprintf(stderr, "Set output buffer framesize error\n");
00228 //              return ;
00229 //      }
00230 
00231     x->initialized = YES;
00232 
00233     fprintf(stderr, "mSampleRate = %g\n", x->deviceFormat.mSampleRate);
00234     fprintf(stderr, "mFormatFlags = %08lX\n", x->deviceFormat.mFormatFlags);
00235     fprintf(stderr, "mBytesPerPacket = %ld\n", x->deviceFormat.mBytesPerPacket);
00236     fprintf(stderr, "mFramesPerPacket = %ld\n", x->deviceFormat.mFramesPerPacket);
00237     fprintf(stderr, "mChannelsPerFrame = %ld\n", x->deviceFormat.mChannelsPerFrame);
00238     fprintf(stderr, "mBytesPerFrame = %ld\n", x->deviceFormat.mBytesPerFrame);
00239     fprintf(stderr, "mBitsPerChannel = %ld\n", x->deviceFormat.mBitsPerChannel);
00240 }
00241 
00242 
00243 void start(t_jamoma_clock *x)
00244 {
00245         OSStatus                err = kAudioHardwareNoError;
00246 
00247     if(!x->initialized)
00248                 return;
00249     if(x->soundPlaying)
00250                 return;
00251 
00252     err = AudioDeviceAddIOProc(x->device, jamoma_clock_coreaudio_callback, (void*)x);   // setup our device with an IO proc
00253     if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError)
00254                 return;
00255     
00256     err = AudioDeviceStart(x->device, jamoma_clock_coreaudio_callback);                         // start playing sound through the device
00257     if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError)
00258                 return;
00259 
00260     x->soundPlaying = true;                                                                     // set the playing status global to true
00261 }
00262 
00263 
00264 void stop(t_jamoma_clock *x)
00265 {
00266     OSStatus    err = kAudioHardwareNoError;
00267     
00268     if(!x->initialized)
00269                 return;
00270     if(!x->soundPlaying)
00271                 return;
00272     
00273     err = AudioDeviceStop(x->device, jamoma_clock_coreaudio_callback);                          // stop playing sound through the device
00274     if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError)
00275                 return;
00276 
00277     err = AudioDeviceRemoveIOProc(x->device, jamoma_clock_coreaudio_callback);                  // remove the IO proc from the device
00278     if(err != kAudioHardwareNoError)
00279                 return;
00280     
00281     x->soundPlaying = false;                                            // set the playing status global to false
00282 }

00285 #endif // MAC_VERSION
00286 /************************************************************************************/
00287 #pragma mark -
00288 #pragma mark Utilities
00289 
00290 unsigned long long jamoma_clock_tickstosamples(t_object *o, double period)
00291 {
00292         t_jamoma_clock *x = (t_jamoma_clock*)o;
00293         return x->sr * (period / DEFAULT_TICKS_PER_SECOND);
00294 }
